data.title: Ishii Kazuo
data.meta_description: Brain - Inspired IT I: Invited papers of the 1st Meeting Entitled Brain IT 2004 held in Hibikino, Kitakuyushu, Japan between 7 and 9 March 2004: v. 1269 (International Congress S.) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Taschenbuch. Condition: Neu. This item is printed on demand - it takes 3-4 days longer - Neuware -Source: Wikipedia. Pages: 129. Kinoaki Matsuo, Prince Yamashina Takehiko, Ito Toshiyoshi, Matsudaira Morio, Tsutomu Sakuma, Saneyoshi Yasuzumi, List of Imperial Japanese Navy admirals, Prince Kacho Hirotsune, Prince Kacho Hirotada, Takeo Hirose, List of Japanese naval commanders, Gensui, Taijiro Aoki, Hisanori Fujita, Mitsuru Yoshida, Chikuhei Nakajima, Eikichi Kato, Raizo Matsuno, Tokugawa Satonari, Jisaku Okada. Excerpt: Isoroku Yamamoto Yamamoto Isoroku, 4 April 1884 ¿ 18 April 1943) was a Japanese Naval Marshal General and the commander-in-chief of the Combined Fleet during World War II, a graduate of the Imperial Japanese Naval Academy and a student of Harvard University (1919¿1921). Yamamoto held several important posts in the Imperial Japanese Navy, and undertook many of its changes and reorganizations, especially its development of naval aviation. He was the commander-in-chief during the decisive early years of the Pacific War and so was responsible for major battles such as Pearl Harbor and Midway. He died during an inspection tour of forward positions in the Solomon Islands when his aircraft (a Mitsub. 132 pp. Englisch.

Contents include BRIDGING THE SPIRITUAL AND THE MUNDANE by Ven. Bhikkhu Bodhi: A journey to a new understanding, A CONSONANCE OF FEELING by Lee van Laer, art by Chantal Heinegg: Painting icons in a modern world, NO IDEAS BUT IN THINGS by Joshua Boettiger: Exploring embodiment, GRACE IS HERE! by David Ulrich and Laura Dunn: A conversation with spiritual pioneer Ram Dass, THE REAL JOHNNY APPLESEED by Ray Silverman: He planted more than just trees., BREATHING OUT: OFFERING OUR CARE by Tara Brach: Transforming suffering, ETHEL MERSTON AND G.I. GURDJIEFF by Mary Ellen Korman: An Englishwoman meets the Fourth Way master, SHODO: THE WAY OF THE BRUSH by Carol Ring, art by Kazuo Ishii: Beauty and wisdom on the path of calligraphy and ink paintings: A NEW SENSE OF RESPONSIBILITY by Roger Lipsey: The enduring significance of Václav Havel, TO TRY TO HAVE SOME HEALING by Richard Whittaker: A conversation with filmmaker Silas Hagerty: SMOKEY THE BEAR SUTRA by Gary Snyder: Hail the American Buddha, WILD PILGRIMAGE by Geneen Marie Haugen: Paying attention to the sacred earth, sri RAMAKRISHNA AT THE TEMPLE OF DAKSHINESWARA edited by Swami Abhedananda: A visit with the "Divine Man"; 128 pages. Paperback in very good condition.

Condition: Cloth bound in new condition. First printing. 39 color illustrations by Kazuo Ishii. One Breath is a testimony of the experiences of a Western student of the ancient discipline of Shodo, a path of spiritual endeavour that originated in Taoism and flowered in Zen. The book follows the writer's first four years of study with a Japanese master calligrapher, intertwining scenes from the lessons and daily practice with glimpses of her inner journey. The texts are paired with calligraphy and ink paintings done by her teacher, Kazuo Ishii, immersing the reader in an authentic experience of traditional Shodo.

Softcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: No Dust Jacket. First Edition. Papers are: Historical Background of the Growth of Modern Industrial Relations: The Dynamics of the Nation State - Japan's Industrial Society by Robert J Ballon; The Exportability of Trade Union Movements - The Japan-US Trade Union Cultural Exchange Program by Bernard Karsh; Continuity and Discontinuity - An Approach to Industrial Relations Systems by Hisashi Kawada; Universalism and Particularism - Challenge for Industrial Relations Research by Solomon B Levine; The Modernization of Industrial Relations in Japan by Ichiro Nakayama; Implications of Dual Allegiance in the Modernization of Industrial Relations n Japan by Kunio Odaka; Traditionalism of Industrial Relations in Japan by Kazuo Okochi; The New Industrial Relations by Arthur M Ross. Impact of Technological and Concomitant Changes of Industrial Relations: The Impact of Technological Changes on Industrial Relations in the Federal Republic of Germany by Friedrich Furstenberg; Industrial Relations - The Influence of Economic and Technological Change by Benjamin C Roberts; The Changing Pattern of Collective Bargaining in Japan by Taishiro Shirai; Impact of Technical Change on Industrial Relations in Japan by Mikio Sumiya; Japanese Wage Structure and Its Significance for International Comparisons by Masumi Tsuda. Changing Role of Government in Industrial Relations: Historical Outline of the Judiciary in Industrial Relations by Toru Ariizumi; The Changing Role of Labour Legislation by Teruhisa Ishii; The Role of the State in Industrial Relations and Its Modernization - The Changing Nature of Governmental Intervention by Masaichiro Ishii; Changing Role of Government in Industrial Relations by Otto Kahn-Freund; Some Aspects of Industrial Relations in Britain from 1954 to 1964 by Hilary A Marquand; An Outline - The Role of the Government in Industrial Relations by Teruo Minemura; The System of Prevention and Settlement of Industrial Disputes in Japan by Tadashi Mitsfuji; Social Security in Japan by Takeshi Takahashi. Lightly rubbed and darkened grey covers with fold-overs, sound binding, clean pages and inside covers. No dust jacket, as published. Quantity Available: 1. Shipped Weight: under 1 kg. Pictures of this item not already displayed here available upon request. Inventory No: 11617081040. For International tracked shipping please select the Priority shipping service.
